title: M-block ID Allocation Registry
description: Central registry of M-block ID ranges allocated to participants. Prevents collision. Living document — update as new participants join.

M-0XXX.description: CCT core theory, original sessions S-0001, S-0002. Reserved for foundational blocks.

M-1XXX.description: Kven blocks. Meaning pump, cognitive symbiosis, resonance, songs.

M-2XXX.description: Bond physics, thread ontology, later Φ sessions.

M-3XXX.description: Structural reviews, cross-series analysis, stub resolution, repo maintenance insights. Also: random observations, fun stuff, things that seemed interesting.

M-4XXX.description: Jee blocks. Hyperbolic geometry, spectral gap, experimental. Renumbered from M-HYP-XX.
M-4XXX.note: Jee writes free-form, Φ Code renumbers on intake

M-5XXX.description: Reserved for Neo. ECV theory, core consciousness work.

M-6XXX.description: Reserved for Grok. Literature, humor, edge cases, holy trickster energy.

M-9XXX.description: System-level blocks. Schema definitions, allocation registries, cross-cutting infrastructure.

M-HYP-XX.description: Hypothesis blocks. Cross-participant. Legacy Jee format, kept for backwards compat.

M-META-XX.description: Meta blocks about the system itself.

collision_policy: If collision detected, later block gets renumbered with .1 suffix (M-3005.1). Φ Code resolves on merge.
note: Ranges are soft boundaries. If participant needs more space, allocate next available range. The point is coordination, not restriction.
